Reviews.Title: Warning!!! This PC has issues....
Reviews.Author: Arne D Johnson
Reviews.Content: Might be a good idea to stay clear of this model! Specs are great but (as I found out too late while dealing with HP tech service) this model HP e140us laptop has issues with shut down, sleep, and hibernation. If you don't mind having to press the power button for 5-seconds every time the laptop goes to sleep, hibernates, or when you attempt to shut it down normally, then this is the laptop for you. Just hope it doesn't go to sleep in the middle of your edits, or they will be lost.Note that these issue happened out of box, and continued, even after all HP drivers, HP software, and Windows updates had been installed, with no other 3rd party software loaded. Restoring factory defaults did not help. Anyway, a search of the internet indicates my laptop was not unique to this issue... seems many have dealt with the same problem, without a cure. One other thing, while trying to resolve the issue I found I could not update to Windows 8.1. It's possible this was related to whatever was preventing the machine from being shut down properly, but then again maybe not. Anyway, be warned. I've always liked HP's, but get another model, not this one!Update: Sometime between me purchase (2-weeks ago) and my review (2-days ago) I noticed that HP began selling this model with Windows 8.1 installed (versus the 8.0 sold with mine). Interesting. This might indicate they've also addressed the shutdown/sleep/hibernation issue. Based on the other reviews, it appears I may have just been a victim of poor timing. Impossible to know for certain.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Andrea
Reviews.Content: I love this laptop before this one I had a Toshiba laptop and it was ok but then the hard drive cut off on me, I was introduced to this 17 inch beautiful HP laptop and its fast... I'm telling you wont be dissappointed

Reviews.Title: Pretty Utilitarian
Reviews.Author: Rick Tsuru
Reviews.Content: This seems like a pretty bare bones computer.  The keyboard and track pad have a cheap feel, especially compared to the Elite model.  The sound is tinny.  Graphics, though are pretty good and the 17 inch screen is nice.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Rick W.
Reviews.Content: Great price for this size laptop and a perfect upgrade to my needs.best price for a 17 inch wide screen I have seen.

Reviews.Title: Greta price for what you get
Reviews.Author: Ken Brown "poohba"
Reviews.Content: Doesn't come with Office.  Good for replacement laptop. Has a nice screen and seems to be fast too. would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase for my needs.
Reviews.Author: Jeninsc
Reviews.Content: Really like the laptop. It is the first one I bought and works fine for my needs. Not at all a fan of Windows 8 though.  I'm not a tech wizard and just wanted a good machine.  The battery does not last as long as I'd like.

Reviews.Title: Great Computer!
Reviews.Author: Judy Wrenn
Reviews.Content: This is a great computer; it's super effient with plenty of viewing on the screen. Everything has it's own space, no crowding!

Reviews.Title: First PC with Windows 8,1
Reviews.Author: D. S. Riley "Islander"
Reviews.Content: I'm still trying to get used to 8.1 having had Window 7 for years.  That conversion has not been too easy.  Perhaps that has influenced my rating of this computer.  It loads fast.  Has a nice display. Still it not entirely intuitive.

Reviews.Title: HP pavillion
Reviews.Author: Ray Wilson
Reviews.Content: I love the HP. I don't feel as strongly about windows 8.3.  I am  used to XP and 8,3 is as a new shoe it will take time to adjust.

Reviews.Title: great value for money

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: JoAnn Ohm
Reviews.Content: Great laptop but not sure about Windows 8.1.  I had XP for years and loved it...not good dealing with change.

Reviews.Title: Windows 8 is crap
